            PROJECT DEV.,TF031463-VIETNAM - SON LA HYDROPOWER PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and institutional development
            impacts are substantial. Regardless of success, key lessons
            suggest: 1) The purpose of commissioning is merely to verify
            flaws in the working system, but not to develop one; hence,
            a good integration of system control, and design cooperation
            is required to prod success. 2) Sound load forecasting is
            required during project preparation, so that transformers,
            and/or other equipment are not overloaded later on, when
            decommissioned. 3) The appointment of independent monitoring
            agencies for resettlement issues, is instrumental to control
            the implementation of resettlement action plans, avoid
            potential delays, resulting from disputes by project
            affected people, and, ease coordination with local
            authorities towards mutually agreed solutions. 4) Successful
            complex operations do require above-average inputs of Bank
            resources, and broad skills mix for project design,
            appraisal, and supervision. 5) The establishment of a
            procurement monitoring system within the project unit,
            supported an effective control mechanism on internal
            procurement decisions.
